poem:
**Dawn Chorus in the Capitol**

In the pre-dawn hush, they barter words,  
a symphony of paper rustling to the tune  
of red and blue debates,  
while the city still sleeps, dreaming of bills  
and numbers dancing in somber halls.  
The nation holds its breath, a collective pause,  
awaiting the dawn,  
when decisions ring out like bird calls.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "House debates Trump’s tax-and-spending bill ahead of final vote – US politics live 9.58am BST Here are some of the images from the last 24 hours in Washington DC: 9.41am BST It is 4.46am in Washington DC. A final vote is expected at about 5.30 am, according to reports. We will bring updates as soon as they come in. For the moment, the final debate is taking place and can be followed via the live". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
